climbs.name: The Sound of Rishas Ears Flapping
climbs.fa: Warren Hughes and Mike Van Volkem

content.description: Crux is passing the third bolt.
content.location: The bolted route just west(right) of the dogleg crack.

content.description: pretty much cruxless. I guess it would be turning the dogleg.
content.protection:
medium to 1 large cam.

two-bolt anchor
content.location: easily visible from the parking lot, this route is  the obvious dogleg crack on the west end of the north face.

content.description: Vertical shallow crack on left side of northeast face.  Once onto the high ledge, step inward and continue to the top.
content.location: Scramble across the top to use the bolted rap anchor atop The Sound Of Risa's Ears Flapping, or downclimb the 5.0 On Ramp more quickly down to the base.

content.description: Start up the face about 20 ft to climber's right of Pick Up Litter, past a shallow hollow up toward the first bolt, then up and left parallel to the left-slanting crack to the second bolt, then up the crack and then out left onto the face when that becomes more featured toward the top.  Rated PG/R in the Bartlett Central JT book.
content.location: Scramble across the top to descend via the bolted rap anchor of The Sound Of Risa's Ears Flapping, or downclimb the 5.0 On Ramp more quickly down to the base.

content.description: Left slanting flaring fist crack to adjacent left of The Sound Of Grains Snapping, that leads up to the same perched boulder at the top.

Facing towards the parking lot for Ryan Mtn., this route is located on the west side of North Cave Rock.

A fun line with newer bolts protecting what I belive to be the route's crux. The third bolt looks like it might hold a feather weight fall but I wouldn't push my luck. The chain anchors are in good shape.

Thank you to whom ever put in the new bolts (2) and took the time to paint them.
content.protection: Joshua Tree guide (Vogel, R.) suggests two bolts, however, the first bolt is gone. Two new bolts (3/8") accompany an original (black) third bolt. Chain anchors on top.
